description: March is here and it is time taste and share the wonderful beers in our Belgian Beer Discovery. Each month the event will help you uncover a new brewery (if we are lucky multiple) and will highlight their beers. Disclaimer - This is a beer event and we will only talk about our favorite frothy beverage. So leave your business cards, pick up lines, and everything else at home. After all it's Friday night!
name: Discovery Hour(s)

description:
Description
Spend an evening indulging in what makes Belgium so great, its beer! Skip the wine pairing and explore the ever popular trend of pairing beer with food. Belgian Beer Discovery will highlight their brewery of the month, Belgoo Brewery. In addition, you will not be disappointed by the food that compliments these amazing local finds. Life couldn't get much better than this.
On the Menu
Starter
First Course: Wild Mushroom Crepe with a Dijon Garlic Cream Sauce Second Course: Picante Shrimp with Bosc Pear, Chevre, Candied Pecans, Cherry Tomatoes, and Red Onions tossed in a White wine and Pear Cider Vinaigrette, Herbed Crostini garnish
Main Dish or Food Experience
Hickory and Sea Salt Seared Pork Medallion, Whiskey Lime BBQ Sauce, Roasted Garlic Polenta with Sweet Corn, Sautéed Spinach and fried Pancetta Garnish
Dessert
Chocolate Torte with Flambéed Clementines, Red Wine Berry Coulis, Homemade Salted Butterscotch and Fresh Whipped Cream with a hint of Ginger
Drinks
First Course: Saisonneke, Clear Blond, hoppy and malty Second Course: Lupoo, Clear golden Blond, slightly hoppy Entree: Arboo, multi grain beer, golden in color, malty with slightly spicy notes Dessert: Magus, yellow, multi grain, citrus and malty.

Make sure to book your spot at:

http://bookalokal.com/meal/530da9e005a346ba0780ce6d?back=%2Fsearch%2FBrussels%2C%2520Belgium
name: Belgian Beer Discovery Dinner - Sold Out

description: A la Becasse is another one of those hidden treasures that make Brussels so special. Although centrally located, it's very easy to miss as you need to walk down a short corridor to get to it. Inside it's all wood panels and turn of the century decor. It's been owned by the same family for over 100 years and there's been a pub on this site for over 500 years. On top of all this: eclectic beer list, traditional Brussels nibbles. What's not to like?
how_to_find_us: Look for me, you already have my picture
name: Historic Bar Exploration @ A la Becasse

description: I regret to inform that this activity has been canceled due to limited attendance. It is with my deepest apologies as the responsible host of this event. We will be doing our best to make sure your experience and satisfaction is fully enjoyable here and continue to enjoy the elements of Brussels Beer Club and all it has to offer.   by: host Stephen Broehl.
name: -Canceled- Beer Pairing Diner at Contre-Temps

description:
Spend an evening indulging in what makes Belgium so great, its beer! Skip the wine pairing and explore the ever popular trend of pairing beer with food. Paul Walsh, a man who spends his days discovering the best beers in Belgium will share his expertise. In addition, you will not be disappointed by the food that compliments these amazing finds. Life couldn't get much better than this.
On the Menu
Starter
Sautéed asparagus wrapped in prosciutto with lemon and garlic, served with a baked pear stuffed with fig and walnut chutney
Main Dish or Food Experience
Second Course: Seared blackened red snapper skin on, served atop shredded cabbage with cilantro tossed in an orange and ginger vinaigrette served with flambéed clementine segments in Cointreau Entree: Pork Cutlets in a brandy, garlic buerre blanc… read more
Dessert
Vanilla bean cheesecake with pecan and ginger crust, smoked sea salt brittle, homemade butterscotch, macerated cranberries and fresh mint garnish
Drinks
First Course: Kriek Girardin Second Course: Jambe de Bois Third Course: Valier Donker Dessert: Troubadour IPA

Make sure that you book your spot at:

http://bookalokal.com/meal/52d342fc868bd89f22ce43f0?back=%2Fsearch%2FBrussels%2C%2520Belgium
name: Belgian Beer Discovery Dinner - Sold Out

description:
Belgian Beer and Food brings Poperinge to Brussels with a unique celebration of its hops, beers and breweries.
Featuring:
Joris Cambie of De Plukker Brewery and Hop Farm
Danny Dieussaert of Van Eecke
An exclusive Poperinge beer tasting lead by Pierre Zuber of Delices et Caprices
Poperinge inspired canapés from chef Emily Gensley
Tickets cost 20 EURO and are available by following this link: http://bookalokal.com/meal/5329ad82b4f748490135ea58?back=%2Fsearch%2FBrussels%2C%2520Belgium
name: Celebrate Poperinge's Beer and Gastronomy in Brussels

description:
Info & Registration: https://www.facebook.com/events/257190537795766/

Meet the author of "A Taste of Molecules: In Search of the Secrets of Flavour" (two chapters on beer!). Diane Fresquez is a former Wall Street Journal correspondent, and author of this new book of food stories and recipes -- with a gentle helping of science.

Live music, and a chance to taste some of the flavours explored in the book: a new beer, brewed by women, for women (but men will like it, too!); a science-inspired banana liqueur from Leuven; and a brand-new mead (honey-wine) from Brussels. 


www.tasteofmolecules.com
name: Book Launch & Tasting - Taste of Molecules

description:
Belgian Beer Day is bringing together Belgian Beer Brewers, regional beer-organizations, social projects and creative minds. Bringing these people together on the city market place ,the place where social life started and belongs, and add the knowledge that the best ideas were thought of by the Bar (=beerstorming* ) this festival should have a good vibe. By toasting and communicating “LIVE” (skype) with other bars and beer-festivals worldwide we want to to show & share this global (beer) solidarity . cheers

Cost: free
http://www.belgianbeerday.com
name: Belgian Beer Day 2014

free entrance

name: De Nacht Van de Grote Dorst

description: The Good Beer Guide Belgium. Co-authors Tim Webb and Joe Stange come to celebrate the launch of the Good Beer Guide Belgium. This is the Guide's seventh edition and the first in five years, a completely updated version of the world’s savviest and most comprehensive guide in any language to the beers of Belgium, who makes them, and where best to drink them. To mark the occasion they will share beers, swap jokes, and vandalize books with fancy pens upon request.
name: Meet the Author - The Good Beer Guide

description:
Details
Belgium’s largest Beer Festival. About 100 brewers. We will schedule a meeting time to take the train from central station with details to come.

http://www.zbf.be/

We will leave from the North Station, and will meet at Waterstones Book Shop Brussels 71-75, Boulevard Adolphe Maxlaan,, Brussels 1000 at 11.30 am. This is a meet the author event for the Good Beer Guide (also listed in this meetup group).
name: Zythos Bierfestival

description:
This is a unique tour between four authentic breweries of Flanders Red Ale: De Brabandere, Bockor, Verhaeghe and Rodenbach.

In all the tour covers just over 50 kilometers, and includes mandatory refreshment breaks at each of the breweries, where you'll sample some excellent examples of this invigorating beer style.

We’ll set off from Brussels at 10:00 am, getting the train to Roeselare via Bruges, and begin the cycling trip at the world renowned Roeselare brewery.

For those who want to concentrate on sampling beer, there are also free buses between the brewery as part of the tour.
Paul will also be conducting drinking and cycling training sessions around Brussels in the run up to the event. For more information about the event see: www.rondjeroodbruin.be
name: Beer Cycling Trip: Rondje Rood Bruin

description:
The Super Bowl may be over, but you can still get your American football fix! Join the American Club of Brussels as we cheer on our official team, the Brussels Tigers, (www.brusselstigers.be) 2002, 2012 and 2013 Belgian Bowl Champions as they battle the Liège Monarchs. Our friends at Bookalokal (www.bookalokal.com) will take care of the food, and our friends from American Beers in Belgium (www.americanbeers.be) will bring our favorite American Microbrews. Menu for the day:

Nachos with Green Chili Queso

Guacamole and Pico de Gallo

Spinach and Artichoke dip with Pita Chips and Fresh Veggies

Sausage Skewers—Garlic Roasted Cherry Tomatoes, Thyme Roasted Mushrooms, Beer Marinated Pearl Onions, and a Dry Smoked Sausage

Turkey Wraps—Peppered Turkey Breast with a Fig Jam, Romaine Greens, Gruyere, Cucumber and red onion, Roasted Garlic Lemon and Cayenne Aioli Event Details:
Place: Evere Sports Complex Av des Anciens Combattants[masked] Evere
Date and Time: Sunday April 27th 2014, 2:00 p.m.
Price: €10 for ACB members, €15 for non-members. Registration: No later than 25th April with payment to hold your place. You may register by e-mail to [masked], online at www.americanclubbrussels.org, or by telephone to the ACB Office Manager (02/[masked]). Payment to ACB at BE[masked] (KREDBEBB) will confirm your reservation. Be sure to mention “Brussels Tigers” in the communications section of the virement. Cancellations are possible until noon on April 25th. Participants canceling after this time, as well as no-shows, are charged the full cost of the event.

If you are late or cannot come at the last minute, please call Brian Dunhill at 0477/[masked] so appropriate arrangements can be made.
name: American Beers with Food and Football

description:
The 2014 edition of Cantillon’s Brewery Quintessence will take place on Thursday, 1 May. We will have the great honour of welcoming our friends Rob Tod, from Allagash Brewing Company, and Vinnie Cilurzo, from Russian River Brewing Company.

Together, we will have you sample our beers during a tasting tour organised in the various rooms of Cantillon Brewery. The following beers will be available for your tasting pleasure:

Allagash: - Allagash White - Allagash Curieux - Allagash Midnight Brett. - Allagash Resurgam - Allagash Coolship Russian River - Pliny the Elder - Shadow of a Doubt - Sanctification - Supplication - Beatification Cantillon - Lambic 2013 - Grand Cru Bruocsella 2010 - Gueuze 2013 - Gueuze 2002 - Kriek - Lou Pepe Kriek 2011 - Rosé de Gambrinus - Fou’foune - Vigneronne - Saint-Lamvinus - Iris - Cuvée Saint-Gilloise - Zwanze 2012 (Rhubarb) - High gravity lambic - Wild Friendship Blend (a blend of our spontaneous fermentation beers, 1/3 Russian River, 1/3 Allagash, 1/3 Cantillon)

Many of the beers will be accompanied by a culinary specialty from Brussels and other delicacies, such as gueuze-ripened cheese, smoked mackerel rillettes, pottekeis, pâté prepared with kriek, pecan tart and others. You will receive a tasting glass produced especially for this event when you arrive at the brewery. The first visitors will be allowed into the brewery at 10 am, with a maximum of 60 people per half-hour thereafter, while the last group will be let in at 6 pm.

Cost: 30€
http://cantillon.be/br/3_18
name: Cantillon Quintessence 2014

description:
★★★ LET BRUSSELS CHOOSE ITS BEER ★★★
4 prototypes, 1 will survive ... you decide !

We also invite our friends Sysmo, Prince Off, Icescreen, Michel Petillo & El Camion !

Come @ Brussels Event Brewery (BEB - Bottelarij Bellevue) -Rue Delaunoystraat 58 - B[masked],5 km from Sainte Catherine!

Free entrance
car / bicycle parking available
4 prototype tasting: 5 euros

●▬▬▬▬▬ 4 PROTOTYPES ▬▬▬▬▬●
come discover the new creations - this time we played on wheat (froment-taerwe) and we went in all directions ! don't expect your traditional white beer :p Proto 01 : Berliner Brusseleir Weisse - Achtung , sour & wild inside ! Proto 02 : Hoppy Witbier - Nelson is alive & is bitter !
Proto 03 : Belgian Hefeweizen - Gross Bertha lost in Brussels !
Proto 04 : Imperial Witbier - Don't trust her look, it's a true witch ! ●▬▬▬▬▬ SYSMO ▬▬▬▬▬●
2 sets : 7.00 pm & 9.00 pm
Sysmo is the phenomenon that makes the earth of Brussels shake on a regular basis. 12 percutionnists guided by a conductor have only one goal : make everybody in the audience dance, from the first person to the last !
http://www.sysmo.be/

●▬▬▬▬▬ Prince Off ▬▬▬▬▬●
Resident at Leftorium, Prince Off will provide his energy throughout the evening. http://www.leftorium.be/tag/prince-off

●▬▬▬▬▬ ARTISTS ▬▬▬▬▬●
>> ICESCREEN - Serigraphy
A young group of serigraphists from the Brussels Art factory , they will do live printing on bottles & teeshirt

>> Michel Petillo - Photography
Michel is a finalist at the European photo competition, Faces of Brewing. Come discover his work !

●▬▬▬▬▬ EL CAMION - FOODTRUCK ▬▬▬▬▬●
A pionneer in Brussels' street food scene, Joel & his team will provide a fine selection of dishes to complete the beer tasting with great food !

●▬▬▬▬▬ FACILITY▬▬▬▬▬●

BRUSSELS EVENT BREWERY (BEB) http://www.eventbrewery.eu/
In the old bottlery of the former Bellevue Brewery
Rue Delaunoystraat 58 - 1080 - BXL
500mt from Porte de Ninove // 1,5 km from the central Sainte Catherine
Parking for cars (5 euros) & bicycles (free)

Map : http://goo.gl/maps/1qiF6
name: Brussels Beer Project - Final Tasting Event

description:
As the weather is improving, we will take our quest for top quality beers to the beer gardens at FourPoints to enjoy their Best Brews Program!

This includes a wide selection of brews featuring local & import craft beers, each chosen for their unique flavors, popularity and quality ingredients. This is a program developed by The World Brewers Association. The beer selection is broken down by style, character and body. Guests can choose a crisp refreshing lager perfect for lighter palates, a smooth thirst quenching Pale Ale or a robust, hearty stout that carries serious flavours.

They also have cheeses to be paired!

Join us in the Lobby bar for HAPPY HOUR 6-7pm!

We will join our friends from the American Club of Brussels and the Brussels British Network for this event.

venue.name: Four Points by Sheraton Brussels Lobby Lounge

name: Historic Bar Tour (Beer Garden)

description:
The Opstalse Bierpallieters have the honour of inviting you to their 23rd Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation which will take place Saturday May 24th and Sunday May 25th, 2014 both starting at 15h00 at Tapperij Beukenhof (Broekstraat 18, 9255 Buggenhout, Belgium). The entrance is free and even more, Zythos and EBCU members are offered a welcome drink.

http://en.bierpallieters.be/weekend

More details to follow.
name: Bierpallieter’s Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation

description:
The Poechenellekelder is right opposite Brussels' most famous - and kitsch - monument, the Mannekin Pis statue, and most people's first reaction would be that it is a classic tourist trap to be avoided at all costs. But go down the steep steps that lead into "The Puppet Cellar" and you'll soon realise that you've stumbled on a wonderfully authentic bar (that includes outdoor seating if this weather continues). The barmen couldn't be more friendly, and the decor is more like a surreal museum than a pub. Apart from the great beer list, they also prepare strange traditional snacks like "tete pressee", a tasty brawn, and "kannibal", the Belgian version of steak tartare served on an open sandwich.

Poechenellekelder


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=spsdU74pnkI
name: Historic Bar Exploration @ Poechenellekelder

description:
Meet, mingle and be seen at the inaugural First Tuesday. This night to remember is brought to you by our friends at: 

BxlConnect - www.bxlconnect.com
Capital-Life - www.capital-life.be
Brussels Beer Club - www.meetup.com/Brussels-Beer-Club

We also will have a chance to finalize the debate started on:

www.belgianbeerandfood.com

As we find out if the beer companies can keep up with the Belgian quality through the beer of:

www.beerproject.be

Delta will be on special all night, until they run out! We already know the answer and that is why we invited the guys behind the beer to join us!
name: First Tuesday @ Scott's Bar

description:
Join authors Tim Webb and Joe Stange and discover the best Belgian beers. "The completely independent guide to Belgian brewing, over 900 Belgian beers plus 500 great places to try them!"

The Good Beer Guide Belgium is an iconic guide to the world-renowned home of serious beers. An indispensible work for all Belgian beer lovers, even in Belgium itself, this guide is already in its 7th edition.

From beer festivals to cosy cafés, upmarket restaurants to brewery tours, this guide is an essential companion for any visit to Belgium or for seeking out Belgian beer round the world.
*Over 900 beers from more than 200 breweries
*530 hand-picked cafés, beers, beer shops and bistros
*The best festivals and brewery tours

venue.name: Four Points by Sheraton Brussels Lobby Lounge

name: Good Beer Guide Belgium - Meet the Authors

description:
Meet, mingle and be seen at First Tuesday as the Brussels Beer Club introduce another small local brewery and give you a chance to meet the brewer.

www.facebook.com/events/[masked]
name: First Tuesday @ Scott's Bar

description: From Friday July 11 until Sunday July 13 Namur will be more than the Walloon capital of Belgium. It will become for a weekend the capital of beers and local products. During 3 days, brouwers and local products producers will share with you their products (150+). We will welcome the whole family: children games, concerts, alcohol-free drinks, etc. And last but not least, you will have free access to the event. http://www.namurcapitaledelabiere.be
name: Namur Capitale de la bière et du terroir

description: Nothing has changed for a century in this historic bar that bears the name of the brewery, "Sudden Death", that supplies its beer. The prices are chalked up on huge mirrors, the walls yellowed with smoke, and waitresses bustle between the tables serving a hundred different beers accompanied by hearty plates of cheese and sausages. A great, noisy meeting place at lunch and early evening for students, businessmen, shoppers and elderly Brussels citizens.
name: Historical Bar Exploration: A la Mort Subite

description:
The official Brussels Beer Club monthly meet up is at Scott's Bar with an offering of over 80 beers (and plenty of other alcohol if you want to bring non beer drinking friends). Meet, mingle and be seen at First Tuesday as we introduce another small brewery and enjoy specials on that beer all night long!

We are also excited to preview for the first time, En Stoemelings new beer! This is a brand new brewery in Brussels and we have only heard good things! Like the facebook page as lots of big news will come out in short order:

https://www.facebook.com/enstoemelings
how_to_find_us: We will be at the bar, and all the bartenders know who we are!
